definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel

sentences.english: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
sentences.chinese: 不知不覺，我的心將我安置在我尊長的車中。

sentences.english: When an elder is standing, do not sit .
sentences.chinese: 當尊長還站着，你不要坐下。

sentences.english: Reverend sir, forgive this pair of sinners.
sentences.chinese: 恭敬的尊長，寬恕這一對犯人吧。

sentences.english: In front of an elder, do not show off.
sentences.chinese: 在尊長的面前，不要賣弄自己的才能。

sentences.english: But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him
sentences.chinese: 祭司長，和文士，與百姓的尊長，都想要殺他。

sentences.english: In front of an elder, I will never show off.
sentences.chinese: 在尊長前，不要賣弄自己的才能。

sentences.english: When meeting an elder, walk briskly towards him.
sentences.chinese: 遇到尊長，要快速的走到他的面前。

definition: of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
